definition: lit. isn't that a joy? (quote from Confucius)/fig. (jocularly) extremely/awfully
(negative prefix)/not/no
also
happy/cheerful/to laugh
music
surname Le
surname Yue
(classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)

sentences.english: That friends should come to one from afar, is this not after all delightful?
sentences.chinese: 有朋自遠方來，不亦樂乎？

sentences.english: The old couple are awfully happy to take care of their grandson.
sentences.chinese: 老倆口每天照顧孫子，忙得不亦樂乎。

sentences.english: Kinds of men and women you come, I come to steal is too busy.
sentences.chinese: 男女老少你來種，我來偷，忙得不亦樂乎。

sentences.english: Banks and businesses are also working feverishly preparing for worst-case scenarios.
sentences.chinese: 銀行和企業也正在不亦樂乎地爲最壞的情況做準備。

sentences.english: And it's not only Swiss chocolate makers who are thriving while others are struggling.
sentences.chinese: 不光瑞士，其他國家的巧克力製造商也忙得不亦樂乎。

sentences.english: Chinese sage Confucius says, "Is it not a delight after all to have friends come from afar!
sentences.chinese: 我國先聖孔子說過，有朋自遠方來，不亦樂乎。

sentences.english: Genial face the wind blowing, we talked about life in an episode enjoying themselves.
sentences.chinese: 迎面吹來和煦的風，大家暢談生活中趣事，不亦樂乎。

sentences.english: Is it not a delight that friends should visit from afar?
sentences.chinese: 友朋自遠方來，不亦樂乎？

sentences.english: Echo Wang (SH) are having fun with the kids there.
sentences.chinese: 王舒芸和小朋友玩得不亦樂乎。

sentences.english: She regaled us with an account of her school-days.
sentences.chinese: 她講她上學時的往事把我們逗得不亦樂乎。

sentences.english: The girls and I have some much fun blowing the super-sized dandelions —lots of them.
sentences.chinese: 這兒的蒲公英又多又大，女兒和我吹得不亦樂乎。

definition: to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest
to enjoy oneself to the full/to one's heart's content
to chat
(of relations) joyous and harmonious
to take pleasure in sth (idiom)
to return from a rewarding journey
seldom/rare/hard to come by
to move back and forth/to fiddle with
to talk freely/to discuss without inhibition
to act as though there were nobody else present/unselfconscious/fig. without regard for others
leisure/free time/unoccupied/not in use
to love sth too much to part with it (idiom); to fondle admiringly
to chat and laugh/to crack jokes/to banter
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
to relieve boredom or melancholy/a diversion
